org.gearvrf

Class GVRActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
          • android.app.Activity
            • org.gearvrf.GVRActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback, IEventReceiver, IScriptable

    public class GVRActivity
extends android.app.Activity
implements IEventReceiver, IScriptable
    The typical GVRF application will have a single Android Activity, which must descend from GVRActivity, not directly from Activity. GVRActivity creates and manages the internal classes which use sensor data to manage a viewpoint, and thus present an appropriate stereoscopic view of your scene graph. GVRActivity also gives GVRF a full-screen window in landscape orientation with no title bar.

      • setScript

        public void setScript(GVRScript gvrScript,
                      java.lang.String dataFileName)
        Deprecated. 
        Links a script to the activity; sets the version;
        Parameters:
        gvrScript - An instance of GVRScript to handle callbacks on the GL thread.
        dataFileName - Name of the XML file containing the framebuffer parameters.

        The XML filename is relative to the application's assets directory, and can specify a file in a directory under the application's assets directory.

      • getFullScreenView

        public android.view.View getFullScreenView()
        Invalidating just the GVRView associated with the GVRViewSceneObject incorrectly set the clip rectangle to just that view. To fix this, we have to create a full screen android View and invalidate this to restore the clip rectangle.
        Returns:
        full screen View object

        the GVRScript.

      • setMain

        public final void setMain(GVRMain gvrMain,
                          java.lang.String dataFileName)
        Links GVRMain to the activity; sets the version;
        Parameters:
        gvrMain - An instance of GVRMain to handle callbacks on the framework thread.
        dataFileName - Name of the XML file containing the framebuffer parameters.

        The XML filename is relative to the application's assets directory, and can specify a file in a directory under the application's assets directory.

      • setForceMonoscopic

        @Deprecated
public void setForceMonoscopic(boolean force)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets whether to force rendering to be single-eye, monoscopic view.
        Parameters:
        force - If true, will create a OvrMonoscopicViewManager when setMain() is called. If false, will proceed to auto-detect whether the device supports VR rendering and choose the appropriate ViewManager. This call will only have an effect if it is called before setMain().

      • getForceMonoscopic

        @Deprecated
public final boolean getForceMonoscopic()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns whether a monoscopic view was asked to be forced during setMain().
        Returns:
        true if monoscopic set, false if not.
        See Also:
        setForceMonoscopic(boolean)

      • registerView

        public final void registerView(android.view.View view)
        It is a convenient function to add a GVRView to Android hierarchy view. UI thread will call GVRView.draw(android.graphics.Canvas) to refresh the view when necessary.
        Parameters:
        view - Is a GVRView that draw itself into some GVRViewSceneObject.
